page.title: 15Methodist Chapel,Allington
page.content: The Methodist Chapel in Allington was originally {built }as a {cottage in {1843.}It has cob walls except for the extention which was built in {1981}and is four years old. The hall was built to make space for meetings of{brownies,}pre-school {playgroup}and{sunday school.}The three cottages, of which one is now the {chapel,}were built by the Young Family.{The chapel}cottage was bought for{Â£30}by some members of the congregation. Before that meetings were held on the village green. The only remains of the upstairs of the cottage is the balcony or{gallery.}The gallery is now used to store{play-group }equipment.The front wall of the chapel is cracking and will have to be repaired soon.{The {River Bourne }runs by the side of The chapel.
